channel.title: Posts on eye Bioinformatician
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on eye Bioinformatician

item.title: Let’s Plot 2: Smoothed Lines
item.description: Data from Aaron Rising. Get data (two xls files) from here: https://github.com/davemcg/Let_us_plot/tree/master/002_smoothed_lines The rmd is also here if you want the source code Two different excel files (Cobra and Eel). Pig names? They have metrics for eye function across time. Aaron told me to take the ‘first tab’ in each excel file. Which is not the case, as at least to me, ‘Sheet 1’ is empty in both. So I’m using the next tab in both, which is ‘Normalized 2 Base For Comb’

item.title: Let’s Plot 1: Going in circles
item.description: What is going on? See https://davemcg.github.io/post/what-is-let-s-plot/ Where to get the code and data? Rmarkdown document: https://github.com/davemcg/Let_us_plot/blob/master/001_polar_figure/polar_plot.Rmd Data: https://github.com/davemcg/Let_us_plot/blob/master/001_polar_figure/polar_values.xlsx First time making a polar plot….let’s see if ggplot2 can do it. Import data with readxl library(tidyverse) ## Warning: package 'tidyverse' was built under R version 3.4.2 ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.2.1 ── ## ✔ ggplot2 2.2.1 ✔ purrr 0.2.4 ## ✔ tibble 1.3.4 ✔ dplyr 0.7.4 ## ✔ tidyr 0.

item.title: What is Let’s Plot?
item.description: The concept is simple - I get data from one of the scientists in my group. Or I get my own. Then I demonstrate, step-by-step, how I generate the plot(s). I’ll also toss in some data science concepts occasionally. Tooling I like R. I like ggplot. I like the tidyverse. That’s what I’ll be using. How can I follow along? Download and install R: https://cran.r-project.org/ Download and install Rstudio: https://www.
